quizzes.question: What is the role of an attribute in HTML?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]HTML Attributes[/h1] Attributes provide [b]additional information[/b] about an element or a tag, while also [b]modifying [/b]them. Most attributes have a value; the value modifies the attribute. [code format="html" codeId="15"]

This text is aligned to center

[/code] In this example, the value of "center" indicates that the content within the p element should be aligned to the center: [img id="2535" width="100%"] [note]Attributes are always specified in the start tag, and they appear in name="value" pairs.[/note]

quizzes.question: What measurement units can be used for the width attribute?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Attribute Measurements  [/h1]

As an example, we can modify the horizontal line so it has a width of 50 pixels.

This can be done by using the width attribute: [code format="html" codeId="16"]<hr [b]width[/b]="50[b]px[/b]" />[/code]
An element's width can also be defined using percentages: [code format="html" codeId="17"]<hr [b]width[/b]="50[b]%[/b]" />[/code]
